title: [BUG] Docker build fails on unable to satisfy requirement for sphinx 2.2.1
body:
### System information
- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**: No
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: MacOS 10.15.1
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: N/A
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**:  1.4.1.dev0
- **Python version**: N/A
- **npm version, if running the dev UI**: N/A
- **Exact command to reproduce**:

Issue command `docker build -t mlflow_dev .`

### Describe the problem
docker build fails with this error:
```
8 26.22 Collecting sphinx==2.2.1 (from -r dev-requirements.txt (line 2))
#8 26.47   ERROR: Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement sphinx==2.2.1 (from -r dev-requirements.txt (line 2)) (from versions: 0.1.61611, 0.1.61798, 0.1.61843, 0.1.61945, 0.1.61950, 0.2, 0.3, 0.4, 0.4.1, 0.4.2, 0.4.3, 0.5, 0.5.1, 0.5.2b1, 0.5.2, 0.6b1, 0.6, 0.6.1, 0.6.2, 0.6.3, 0.6.4, 0.6.5, 0.6.6, 0.6.7, 1.0b1, 1.0b2, 1.0, 1.0.1, 1.0.2, 1.0.3, 1.0.4, 1.0.5, 1.0.6, 1.0.7, 1.0.8, 1.1, 1.1.1, 1.1.2, 1.1.3, 1.2b1, 1.2b2, 1.2b3, 1.2, 1.2.1, 1.2.2, 1.2.3, 1.3b1, 1.3b2, 1.3b3, 1.3, 1.3.1, 1.3.2, 1.3.3, 1.3.4, 1.3.5, 1.3.6, 1.4a1, 1.4b1, 1.4, 1.4.1, 1.4.2, 1.4.3, 1.4.4, 1.4.5, 1.4.6, 1.4.7, 1.4.8, 1.4.9, 1.5a1, 1.5a2, 1.5b1, 1.5, 1.5.1, 1.5.2, 1.5.3, 1.5.4, 1.5.5, 1.5.6, 1.6b1, 1.6b2, 1.6b3, 1.6.1, 1.6.2, 1.6.3, 1.6.4, 1.6.5, 1.6.6, 1.6.7, 1.7.0b1, 1.7.0b2, 1.7.0, 1.7.1, 1.7.2, 1.7.3, 1.7.4, 1.7.5, 1.7.6, 1.7.7, 1.7.8, 1.7.9, 1.8.0b1, 1.8.0, 1.8.1, 1.8.2, 1.8.3, 1.8.4, 1.8.5)
#8 26.47 ERROR: No matching distribution found for sphinx==2.2.1 (from -r dev-requirements.txt (line 2))
------
```

### Code to reproduce issue
Use Dockerfile in the master branch

### Other info / logs
Here is the full docker build error with error.
[docker_build_error_2019_11_14.txt](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/files/3849660/docker_build_error_2019_11_14.txt)

The package sphinx 2.2.1 now requires Python 3.  The base image used in the Dockerfile is `continuumio/miniconda`, which provides a Python 2.x environment.  If it is reasonable, I can submit a PR to that changes the base image to miniconda3.
